topic: Latest global political and military news
rawMarkdown:
# Latest global political and military news

**Date**: 2026/1/27 23:44

## Executive Summary
Hello everyone, this is Yun Jian, your host from the Daily News Channel. Welcome to today's Daily News Channel, where we'll bring you the latest global political and military developments of the past 24 hours. This episode features a multitude of highlights: Russia launched a large-scale drone strike on multiple locations in Ukraine; Zelensky called on international partners to exert pressure; high-ranking Moscow military officials inspected the front lines and claimed to have seized over 500 square kilometers of land in January; meanwhile, trilateral negotiations between Russia, Ukraine, and the US are expected to resume on February 1st; the US Abraham Lincoln carrier strike group deployed to the Middle East in response to tensions with Iran; Trump stated that Iran wanted to negotiate, while Tehran issued a warning; the investigation of high-ranking Chinese military officials, including Zhang Youxia, has raised concerns about the PLA's combat readiness; the new US defense strategy prioritizes homeland and Chinese stability; NATO Secretary General Rutte warned that Europe cannot function without US military support, and France retaliated by pushing for strategic autonomy; tensions are rising in the South China Sea and the Taiwan Strait; the Philippines' purchase of US missiles angered China, and China canceled 49 flights to Japan; in addition, events such as the US airstrikes in Venezuela, the Sudanese military's breach of siege, and the Iranian crackdown that resulted in over 6,000 deaths have occurred. Let's delve into the pulse behind these major news stories one by one.

## Situation Analysis
Hello everyone, this is Yun Jian, your host from the Daily News Channel. Welcome to today's Daily News Channel, where we'll bring you the latest global political and military developments of the past 24 hours. This episode features a multitude of highlights: Russia launched a large-scale drone strike on multiple locations in Ukraine; Zelensky called on international partners to exert pressure; high-ranking Moscow military officials inspected the front lines and claimed to have seized over 500 square kilometers of land in January; meanwhile, trilateral negotiations between Russia, Ukraine, and the US are expected to resume on February 1st; the US Abraham Lincoln carrier strike group deployed to the Middle East in response to tensions with Iran; Trump stated that Iran wanted to negotiate, while Tehran issued a warning; the investigation of high-ranking Chinese military officials, including Zhang Youxia, has raised concerns about the PLA's combat readiness; the new US defense strategy prioritizes homeland and Chinese stability; NATO Secretary General Rutte warned that Europe cannot function without US military support, and France retaliated by pushing for strategic autonomy; tensions are rising in the South China Sea and the Taiwan Strait; the Philippines' purchase of US missiles angered China, and China canceled 49 flights to Japan; in addition, events such as the US airstrikes in Venezuela, the Sudanese military's breach of siege, and the Iranian crackdown that resulted in over 6,000 deaths have occurred. Let's delve into the pulse behind these major news stories one by one.

## Key Intelligence

### More than 165 Russian drones attacked Odessa and other locations in Ukraine; Zelensky called for international pressure.
**Source**: UNN / The Independent

According to UNN and The Independent, on January 27, 2026, Russia launched over 165 attack drones in a fierce assault on Odessa, Kherson, and Lviv, Ukraine. Odessa was hit by more than 50 drones, damaging energy and civilian targets, severely injuring five residential buildings and a church, and injuring dozens of people, including children. Shelling in the Kherson region caused buildings to catch fire, and infrastructure in Lviv was also affected. Ukrainian President Zelensky condemned such actions as undermining the diplomatic process and called on the United States and European partners not to remain silent, but to pressure Moscow through sanctions and a blockade of the Russian oil tanker fleet. DTEK confirmed that Odessa's energy facilities were severely damaged, and repairs would be time-consuming. Meanwhile, Russian President Putin's special envoy Kirill Dmitriev stated that Ukraine's withdrawal from Donbas is a key path to peace. This attack exacerbated the civilian plight and tested upcoming diplomatic negotiations.

**Reference**: https://unn.ua/en/news/every-such-russian-strike-undermines-diplomacy-zelenskyy-expects-america-and-other-partners-not-to-remain-silent-after-a-new-russian-attack;https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/ukraine-russia-war-live-putin-zelensky-trump-eu-nato-b2908185.html

### Russian Chief of the General Staff Gerasimov inspected troops in eastern Ukraine, claiming that they had seized over 500 square kilometers of land in January.
**Source**: Al Arabiya

According to a report from Al Arabiya, on January 27, 2026, Valery Gerasimov, Chief of the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces, inspected troops of the Western Forces in eastern Ukraine to assess the progress of their operations. He declared that Russian forces had seized over 500 square kilometers of Ukrainian territory in January and would continue their offensive along the entire front. This visit followed the trilateral talks in Abu Dhabi, with the next round of negotiations expected on February 1. Gerasimov's trip highlights Moscow's focus on the front lines and reflects the continuously evolving battlefield situation, despite the dual pressures of the energy crisis and cold weather facing Ukraine. This could potentially influence upcoming diplomatic efforts.

**Reference**: https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2026/01/27/russian-takes-more-than-500-square-km-of-ukraine-in-january-russia-s-top-general-says

### The USS Abraham Lincoln carrier strike group has been deployed to the Middle East to address tensions with Iran.
**Source**: Gulf News

According to Gulf News, on January 26, 2026, the U.S. nuclear-powered aircraft carrier USS Abraham Lincoln (CVN-72), accompanied by the destroyers USS Spruance, USS Michael Murphy, and USS Frank E. Peterson Jr., entered Middle Eastern waters under the command of the U.S. Fifth Fleet Central Command. The deployment aims to enhance firepower and support defense or potential operations against Iran; the carrier has previously targeted the Houthi rebels and Iran. This move stems from escalating regional tensions and tensions with Iran, with Trump administration officials stating they would strengthen naval dominance despite protests and warnings. The carrier's arrival in the Arabian Sea further underscores the U.S. military's strategic presence in the Middle East.

**Reference**: https://gulfnews.com/world/mena/uss-abraham-lincoln-aircraft-carrier-in-the-middle-east-what-you-need-to-know-1.500421868

### China is investigating high-ranking officials, including Zhang Youxia, vice chairman of the Central Military Commission, for allegedly leaking nuclear secrets and engaging in corruption.
**Source**: FDD Overnight Brief, Atalayar, Bloomberg

Data from FDD Overnight Brief, Atalayar, and Bloomberg shows that from January 24 to 26, 2026, China's Ministry of National Defense announced investigations into Zhang Youxia, Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission, and Liu Zhenli, Chief of the Joint Staff Department, on charges including serious disciplinary violations, leaking nuclear secrets to the United States, corruption, and challenging Xi Jinping's authority. Zhang Youxia is a close confidant of Xi and an official in the nuclear program; this move deepens Xi's purge, leaving only Xi and himself in the Central Military Commission. Analysts say this leads to instability within the People's Liberation Army, reduced combat readiness, and increased risks in the Taiwan direction, which Taipei describes as unusual. The incident exposes a power struggle at the highest levels.

**Reference**: https://www.fdd.org/overnight-brief/january-26-2026/,https://www.atalayar.com/en/articulo/gustavo-aristegui/geopolitical-report-january-26-2026/20260126202508222824.html,https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2026-01-27/xi-s-military-purges-raise-questions-over-china-s-pla-readiness

### The US releases its 2026 defense strategy, prioritizing homeland deterrence against China and providing limited assistance to allies.
**Source**: CSIS, GMFUS, Taiwan Plus

An analysis by CSIS, GMFUS, and Taiwan Plus indicates that the Trump administration's National Defense Strategy (renamed the War Department after the Department of Defense) to be released on January 23, 2026, will shift its focus to prioritizing homeland and border security, followed by China, seeking stable diplomacy rather than confrontation, deterrence in the Indo-Pacific, emphasizing allies sharing the burden in Europe and the Asia-Pacific, and making no mention of Taiwan. Unlike previous strategies that viewed China as the primary threat, the focus now shifts to the Western Hemisphere and the industrial base. This move may promote US-China stability, but allies are concerned about reduced support.

**Reference**: https://www.csis.org/analysis/what-does-trump-administrations-new-national-defense-strategy-say-about-china,https://www.gmfus.org/news/us-national-defense-strategy,https://www.taiwanplus.com/news/taiwan-talks/international-analysis/260127017/china-purges-general-why-new-us-defense-strategy-isnt-downplaying-china,https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mGv_QKS-CWA

### NATO Secretary General Rutte warned Europe that it would be unable to defend itself without the US, and France retaliated.
**Source**: Associated Press via KOSU

According to an Associated Press report via KOSU, on January 27, 2026, in Brussels, NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte told EU lawmakers that Europe cannot defend itself without US military assistance, including a nuclear umbrella, and that defense spending needs to double to 10% of GDP. This comes amid calls for increased military spending due to Trump's Greenland threat and France's calls for strategic autonomy. French Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot countered that Europeans must be responsible for being the European pillar of NATO. Rutte praised Trump's push for increased spending but rejected the idea of an EU military. This highlights the transatlantic divide.

**Reference**: https://www.kosu.org/news/2026-01-27/nato-chief-wishes-good-luck-to-those-who-think-europe-can-defend-itself-without-us-help

### The Philippine military has confirmed that a Philippine citizen was a Russian mercenary who died in Ukraine.
**Source**: Philstar

According to Philstar, on January 27, 2026, the Philippine military confirmed a Ukrainian report that a Filipino national had been killed while fighting as a Russian mercenary in Ukraine. The Russo-Ukrainian war has resulted in hundreds of thousands of deaths and millions of displacements, with Russia recruiting thousands of foreign nationals to fight. This incident serves as a reminder of the global issue of mercenaries.

**Reference**: https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2026/01/27/2503836/military-verifying-ukraine-report-filipino-killed-fighting-russia

### Hamas seeks police role in Gaza, former disarmament negotiator
**Source**: Al Arabiya

According to Al Arabiya, on January 27, 2026, Hamas, having controlled less than half of Gaza following the Trump-brokered October ceasefire, sought to have its police play a role in upcoming disarmament negotiations. The source stated this move was intended to maintain order, but it has sparked controversy.

**Reference**: https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2026/01/27/hamas-seeks-role-for-its-police-in-gaza-ahead-of-disarmament-talks-sources

### The Philippines plans to purchase the US Typhoon missile system; China warns of an arms race.
**Source**: CBS News

CBS News reported that on January 27, 2026, the Philippines announced its purchase of the U.S. Typhoon missile system to safeguard its rights in the South China Sea, prompting a warning from China that it would trigger an arms race. The U.S. ambassador condemned China's water cannon attacks on Philippine vessels, endangering lives. The South China Sea dispute has recently escalated.

**Reference**: https://www.cbsnews.com/tag/south-china-sea/

### Xi Jinping spoke with Vietnam Party General Secretary To Lan, emphasizing the need to deepen bilateral relations.
**Source**: China Daily / Xinhua / Global Times

According to reports from China Daily, Xinhua News Agency, and the Global Times, on the evening of January 26, 2026, Xi Jinping spoke by phone with To Lan, General Secretary of the Communist Party of Vietnam, emphasizing the need to deepen bilateral relations and promote cooperation. Both sides pledged closer collaboration, a move that highlights the strong ties between China and Vietnam amidst regional dynamics.

**Reference**: https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/latestnews210

### China cancels 49 flights to Japan, escalating tensions.
**Source**: China Daily

According to China Daily, starting January 26, 2026, China will cancel all 49 flights to Japan, updated to January 27. This move stems from political and military tensions and could escalate bilateral friction.

**Reference**: https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/latestnews210

### Zelensky said the next round of talks between Ukraine, the US, and Russia may be held on February 1.
**Source**: China Daily

According to China Daily, on January 27, 2026, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy stated that Ukraine, the United States, and Russia might hold their next meeting on February 1, indicating potential progress in conflict diplomacy.

**Reference**: https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/latestnews210

### A UN report states that Iran's crackdown on protests has resulted in over 6,126 deaths.
**Source**: NPR

According to NPR, citing UN data, as of January 27, 2026, more than 6,126 people have died in nationwide protests in Iran, exacerbating political turmoil.

**Reference**: https://www.npr.org/2026/01/27/nx-s1-5689793/6-126-iran-crackdown-protests-death-toll

### Poland emerges as a new security pole in Europe, with large-scale arms purchases strengthening its eastern flank.
**Source**: Anadolu Agency

According to Anadolu Agency, on January 27, 2026, Poland will become a European security hub through massive military purchases and the reinforcement of 124 miles of its eastern border by 2026, enhancing NATO's deterrence against the Russian threat on its eastern flank.

**Reference**: https://www.aa.com.tr/en/europe/-indispensable-new-pole-poland-reshapes-europe-s-security-map/3812047

### Sudanese army ends two-year siege of Dilin in South Kodofan province by rapid support forces.
**Source**: Anadolu Ajansı, Al Arabiya

Anadolu Ajansı and Al Arabiya reported that on January 27, 2026, the Sudanese army successfully defeated the Rapid Support Force (RSF) and severely damaged its militias, ending a two-year siege of Dilin, the second largest city in South Kodofan province. The army vowed to eliminate the RSF to stabilize the country, and this was part of the Kodofan offensive.

**Reference**: https://www.aa.com.tr/en/world/morning-briefing-jan-27-2026/3811620, https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2026/01/27/sudan-army-breaks-rsf-siege-on-southern-city-of-dilling

### US airstrikes near Caracas, Venezuela, kill dozens of people.
**Source**: Wikipedia / Various

According to reports from Wikipedia, the NYT, and Al Jazeera, on January 27, 2026, the US Operation Southern Spear launched airstrikes on the Fort Tiuna and Francisco de Miranda air bases near Caracas, using Hellfire missiles, killing 40-100 people, including civilians, 23 Venezuelan soldiers, and 32 Cuban personnel. Maduro declared a national emergency, and the FAA lifted the no-fly zone over the Caribbean; this was part of the war on drugs.

**Reference**: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events/January_2026

### Iran warns of increased vulnerability from US aircraft carrier deployment; Tehran's Billboard mocks the move.
**Source**: RTHK

RTHK reports that on January 27, 2026, the US Abraham Lincoln Strike Group increased its firepower in the Middle East near Iran. Iranian officials stated that the increased vulnerability was a factor, and billboards in New Tehran depicted a destroyed aircraft carrier with the phrase "wind and storm." Hezbollah rallies warned of an attack on Iran, igniting the entire region. Trump stated that the fleet was in position, and Iran wanted to make a deal. Economic protests have continued since December.

**Reference**: https://gbcode.rthk.hk/TuniS/news.rthk.hk/rthk/en/component/k2/1841473-20260127.htm

### Scholars say a window of stability exists between the US and China in 2026, but it is fragile.
**Source**: China Daily

China Daily updated on January 27, 2026: A seminar by experts David Kang and Robert Sutter stated that the US-China relationship is better than it is at the end of 2025. Trump's deal-oriented approach ignores threats, but increased defense budgets may create tension. Concerns are raised about Taiwan (US sale of 11B weapons in 2025), and the outlook for the Asia-Pacific region is pessimistic. High-level contacts are crucial.

**Reference**: https://global.chinadaily.com.cn/a/202601/27/WS69783d3da310d6866eb35f75.html

### European Parliament postpones decision on EU-US trade agreement
**Source**: China Daily

According to China Daily, on January 27, 2026, the European Parliament's decision to extend the EU-US trade agreement will impact transatlantic political and economic relations.

**Reference**: https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/latestnews210

### Myanmar's pro-military party declared victory in the general election, and the military government underwent a complete transformation.
**Source**: Taipei Times

According to the Taipei Times, in an election manipulated by the Myanmar military junta on January 27, 2026, the US Democratic Party (USDP) claimed a majority of seats and will form a government under President Min Aung Hlaing. Observers criticize this as a repackaging of military rule following the 2021 coup, which could trigger a civil war.

**Reference**: https://www.taipeitimes.com/News/world/archives/2026/01/27/2003851303

### Saudi Arabia accuses the UAE of interfering in Yemen and Libya, threatening a new crisis.
**Source**: Taipei Times

According to the Taipei Times, on January 27, 2026, Saudi media attacked the UAE for human rights abuses, supported the separatist movement in Yemen and Ras Mosque in Libya, and advocated for the division of Africa. This further exacerbates the rifts in the Gulf following the conflict in Yemen.

**Reference**: https://www.taipeitimes.com/News/world/archives/2026/01/27/2003851302

### The war in Ukraine plunged Kyiv into darkness and extreme cold; Zelensky criticized the West for insufficient pressure.
**Source**: Atalayar

Atalayar reports that on January 26, 2026, following tripartite negotiations in Abu Dhabi, Zelensky emphasized that he would not relinquish territory in exchange for EU membership, criticizing the West for its weak pressure on Russia. The Russian ground offensive resulted in casualties and infrastructure destruction, and the extreme cold exacerbated the plight of civilians.

**Reference**: https://www.atalayar.com/en/articulo/politics/the-war-in-ukraine-plunges-kyiv-into-darkness-and-extreme-cold/20260126120613222785.html

### Qatar launches the Arabian Gulf Security 4 joint military exercise, with US special forces participating.
**Source**: Khaleej Times / WAM

According to the Khaleej Times, from January 26 to February 4, 2026, Qatar, the UAE, Gulf Cooperation Council countries, and US special forces will conduct "Arabian Gulf Security 4" exercises in the Arabian Gulf, involving over 260 hours of training across more than 70 scenarios, focusing on counter-terrorism emergency command. The exercises aim to enhance Gulf security cooperation.

**Reference**: https://www.khaleejtimes.com/world/gulf/qatar-joint-military-exercise-uae-gcc-us-units

### US RQ-4B Global Hawk and MQ-4C Triton drones are monitoring Iran from the UAE.
**Source**: DefenceGeek Twitter

According to DefenceGeek's Twitter account, on January 27, 2026, at Al Dhafra Air Base in Abu Dhabi, three US Air Force RQ-4B Global Hawks and two Navy MQ-4C Tritons were deployed to monitor Iran and enhance intelligence capabilities in the Middle East.

**Reference**: https://x.com/DefenceGeek

### Fujian Coast Guard conducts routine patrol in Kinmen; Taiwan military conducts live-fire exercise in northeastern waters.
**Source**: Global Times

According to the Global Times, on January 26, 2026, the Fujian Coast Guard conducted a routine law enforcement patrol in waters near Kinmen, while Taiwan's Ministry of National Defense fired shots in waters northeast of Taiwan. Tensions across the Taiwan Strait continue.

**Reference**: https://www.globaltimes.cn/china/society/index.html

### French Foreign Minister responds to Rutte: Europe must assume its own security responsibility
**Source**: Politico

According to Politico, on January 27, 2026, in Brussels, after Rutte stated that Europe would be vulnerable without the US, French Foreign Minister Barrot posted on X, "Europeans can and must be responsible for security." Trump's Greenland tensions and the US strategic shift are prompting Europe to take a leading role in addressing the Russian threat.

**Reference**: https://www.politico.eu/article/france-snaps-back-nato-mark-rutte-european-defense/

### US-Iran tensions push up oil prices despite oversupply.
**Source**: Anadolu Ajansı

According to Anadolu Ajansı, on January 26, 2026, Middle East geopolitical risks, particularly US-Iran tensions, increased oil price risk premiums despite ample supply. The biggest pressure on the US comes from the Iranian economy, and Libyan oil prices are also linked to record levels.

**Reference**: https://www.aa.com.tr/en/energy/oil/oil-edges-higher-on-us-iran-tensions/54289

### Hamas claims the retrieval of the last hostage's body proves its commitment to a ceasefire.
**Source**: China Daily

According to China Daily, on January 26-27, 2026, Hamas claimed to have retrieved the bodies of the last hostages from Gaza, demonstrating its commitment to the ceasefire amidst political developments in the Middle East.

**Reference**: https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/latestnews210

### Nigeria accuses military officers of coup attempt; US reveals directed energy weapon used to capture Maduro.
**Source**: GeopoliticsUnplugged

According to GeopoliticsUnplugged, on January 26, 2026, Nigeria detained 16 soldiers in a suspected coup attempt against President Tinubu; Trump revealed that the US used 'Discombobulator' directed energy weapons and cyber tools to capture Maduro, paralyzing Venezuela's defense.

**Reference**: https://geopoliticsunplugged.substack.com/p/eu-formally-kicks-out-russia-5k-gold

### Rutte criticizes the EU's dream of strategic autonomy, saying Europe needs to double its spending.
**Source**: Le Monde

Le Monde reports that on January 27, 2026, in Brussels, Rutte rejected EU autonomy, stating that without the US nuclear umbrella, defense spending would need to double. France must be held accountable for its anti-European stance.

**Reference**: https://www.lemonde.fr/en/international/article/2026/01/27/nato-chief-mark-rutte-warns-europe-it-can-t-defend-itself-without-the-us_6749843_4.html

### Europe accelerates its rearmament program, emerging as a new superpower.
**Source**: The Telegraph

According to The Telegraph, on January 26, 2026, following Trump's threats, Europe accelerated its rearmament, with Ukraine planning to produce 20 million drones by 2026.

**Reference**: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2026/01/26/plans-turn-europe-new-superpower/

### Trump becomes a burden on Europe's far right; Greenland's tariffs alienate allies.
**Source**: NYT

According to the NYT, on January 27, 2026, European nationalists distanced themselves from Trump due to threats to Greenland, tariffs, and sovereignty challenges, leading to a shift in the previous alliance.

**Reference**: https://www.nytimes.com/2026/01/27/world/europe/trump-liability-europe-far-right-populists.html

Let's delve into the pulse behind these major news stories one by one.

newsItems.title: Zelensky said the next round of talks between Ukraine, the US, and Russia may be held on February 1.
newsItems.summary: According to China Daily, on January 27, 2026, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy stated that Ukraine, the United States, and Russia might hold their next meeting on February 1, indicating potential progress in conflict diplomacy.

newsItems.title: A UN report states that Iran's crackdown on protests has resulted in over 6,126 deaths.
newsItems.summary: According to NPR, citing UN data, as of January 27, 2026, more than 6,126 people have died in nationwide protests in Iran, exacerbating political turmoil.

newsItems.title: Poland emerges as a new security pole in Europe, with large-scale arms purchases strengthening its eastern flank.
newsItems.summary: According to Anadolu Agency, on January 27, 2026, Poland will become a European security hub through massive military purchases and the reinforcement of 124 miles of its eastern border by 2026, enhancing NATO's deterrence against the Russian threat on its eastern flank.

newsItems.title: Sudanese army ends two-year siege of Dilin in South Kodofan province by rapid support forces.
newsItems.summary: Anadolu Ajansı and Al Arabiya reported that on January 27, 2026, the Sudanese army successfully defeated the Rapid Support Force (RSF) and severely damaged its militias, ending a two-year siege of Dilin, the second largest city in South Kodofan province. The army vowed to eliminate the RSF to stabilize the country, and this was part of the Kodofan offensive.

newsItems.title: US airstrikes near Caracas, Venezuela, kill dozens of people.
newsItems.summary: According to reports from Wikipedia, the NYT, and Al Jazeera, on January 27, 2026, the US Operation Southern Spear launched airstrikes on the Fort Tiuna and Francisco de Miranda air bases near Caracas, using Hellfire missiles, killing 40-100 people, including civilians, 23 Venezuelan soldiers, and 32 Cuban personnel. Maduro declared a national emergency, and the FAA lifted the no-fly zone over the Caribbean; this was part of the war on drugs.

references.source: Wikipedia / Various (NYT, Al Jazeera, Reuters, BNO News, The Times, CNN, El Tiempo, The Aviationist)

newsItems.title: Iran warns of increased vulnerability from US aircraft carrier deployment; Tehran's Billboard mocks the move.
newsItems.summary: RTHK reports that on January 27, 2026, the US Abraham Lincoln Strike Group increased its firepower in the Middle East near Iran. Iranian officials stated that the increased vulnerability was a factor, and billboards in New Tehran depicted a destroyed aircraft carrier with the phrase "wind and storm." Hezbollah rallies warned of an attack on Iran, igniting the entire region. Trump stated that the fleet was in position, and Iran wanted to make a deal. Economic protests have continued since December.

newsItems.title: Scholars say a window of stability exists between the US and China in 2026, but it is fragile.
newsItems.summary: China Daily updated on January 27, 2026: A seminar by experts David Kang and Robert Sutter stated that the US-China relationship is better than it is at the end of 2025. Trump's deal-oriented approach ignores threats, but increased defense budgets may create tension. Concerns are raised about Taiwan (US sale of 11B weapons in 2025), and the outlook for the Asia-Pacific region is pessimistic. High-level contacts are crucial.

newsItems.title: European Parliament postpones decision on EU-US trade agreement
newsItems.summary: According to China Daily, on January 27, 2026, the European Parliament's decision to extend the EU-US trade agreement will impact transatlantic political and economic relations.

newsItems.title: Myanmar's pro-military party declared victory in the general election, and the military government underwent a complete transformation.
newsItems.summary: According to the Taipei Times, in an election manipulated by the Myanmar military junta on January 27, 2026, the US Democratic Party (USDP) claimed a majority of seats and will form a government under President Min Aung Hlaing. Observers criticize this as a repackaging of military rule following the 2021 coup, which could trigger a civil war.

newsItems.title: Saudi Arabia accuses the UAE of interfering in Yemen and Libya, threatening a new crisis.
newsItems.summary: According to the Taipei Times, on January 27, 2026, Saudi media attacked the UAE for human rights abuses, supported the separatist movement in Yemen and Ras Mosque in Libya, and advocated for the division of Africa. This further exacerbates the rifts in the Gulf following the conflict in Yemen.

newsItems.title: The war in Ukraine plunged Kyiv into darkness and extreme cold; Zelensky criticized the West for insufficient pressure.
newsItems.summary: Atalayar reports that on January 26, 2026, following tripartite negotiations in Abu Dhabi, Zelensky emphasized that he would not relinquish territory in exchange for EU membership, criticizing the West for its weak pressure on Russia. The Russian ground offensive resulted in casualties and infrastructure destruction, and the extreme cold exacerbated the plight of civilians.

newsItems.title: Qatar launches the Arabian Gulf Security 4 joint military exercise, with US special forces participating.
newsItems.summary: According to the Khaleej Times, from January 26 to February 4, 2026, Qatar, the UAE, Gulf Cooperation Council countries, and US special forces will conduct "Arabian Gulf Security 4" exercises in the Arabian Gulf, involving over 260 hours of training across more than 70 scenarios, focusing on counter-terrorism emergency command. The exercises aim to enhance Gulf security cooperation.

newsItems.title: US RQ-4B Global Hawk and MQ-4C Triton drones are monitoring Iran from the UAE.
newsItems.summary: According to DefenceGeek's Twitter account, on January 27, 2026, at Al Dhafra Air Base in Abu Dhabi, three US Air Force RQ-4B Global Hawks and two Navy MQ-4C Tritons were deployed to monitor Iran and enhance intelligence capabilities in the Middle East.

newsItems.title: Fujian Coast Guard conducts routine patrol in Kinmen; Taiwan military conducts live-fire exercise in northeastern waters.
newsItems.summary: According to the Global Times, on January 26, 2026, the Fujian Coast Guard conducted a routine law enforcement patrol in waters near Kinmen, while Taiwan's Ministry of National Defense fired shots in waters northeast of Taiwan. Tensions across the Taiwan Strait continue.

newsItems.title: French Foreign Minister responds to Rutte: Europe must assume its own security responsibility
newsItems.summary: According to Politico, on January 27, 2026, in Brussels, after Rutte stated that Europe would be vulnerable without the US, French Foreign Minister Barrot posted on X, "Europeans can and must be responsible for security." Trump's Greenland tensions and the US strategic shift are prompting Europe to take a leading role in addressing the Russian threat.

newsItems.title: US-Iran tensions push up oil prices despite oversupply.
newsItems.summary: According to Anadolu Ajansı, on January 26, 2026, Middle East geopolitical risks, particularly US-Iran tensions, increased oil price risk premiums despite ample supply. The biggest pressure on the US comes from the Iranian economy, and Libyan oil prices are also linked to record levels.

newsItems.title: Hamas claims the retrieval of the last hostage's body proves its commitment to a ceasefire.
newsItems.summary: According to China Daily, on January 26-27, 2026, Hamas claimed to have retrieved the bodies of the last hostages from Gaza, demonstrating its commitment to the ceasefire amidst political developments in the Middle East.

newsItems.title: Nigeria accuses military officers of coup attempt; US reveals directed energy weapon used to capture Maduro.
newsItems.summary: According to GeopoliticsUnplugged, on January 26, 2026, Nigeria detained 16 soldiers in a suspected coup attempt against President Tinubu; Trump revealed that the US used 'Discombobulator' directed energy weapons and cyber tools to capture Maduro, paralyzing Venezuela's defense.

newsItems.title: Rutte criticizes the EU's dream of strategic autonomy, saying Europe needs to double its spending.
newsItems.summary: Le Monde reports that on January 27, 2026, in Brussels, Rutte rejected EU autonomy, stating that without the US nuclear umbrella, defense spending would need to double. France must be held accountable for its anti-European stance.

newsItems.title: Europe accelerates its rearmament program, emerging as a new superpower.
newsItems.summary: According to The Telegraph, on January 26, 2026, following Trump's threats, Europe accelerated its rearmament, with Ukraine planning to produce 20 million drones by 2026.

newsItems.title: Trump becomes a burden on Europe's far right; Greenland's tariffs alienate allies.
newsItems.summary: According to the NYT, on January 27, 2026, European nationalists distanced themselves from Trump due to threats to Greenland, tariffs, and sovereignty challenges, leading to a shift in the previous alliance.

executiveSummary: Hello everyone, this is Yun Jian, your host from the Daily News Channel. Welcome to today's Daily News Channel, where we'll bring you the latest global political and military developments of the past 24 hours. This episode features a multitude of highlights: Russia launched a large-scale drone strike on multiple locations in Ukraine; Zelensky called on international partners to exert pressure; high-ranking Moscow military officials inspected the front lines and claimed to have seized over 500 square kilometers of land in January; meanwhile, trilateral negotiations between Russia, Ukraine, and the US are expected to resume on February 1st; the US Abraham Lincoln carrier strike group deployed to the Middle East in response to tensions with Iran; Trump stated that Iran wanted to negotiate, while Tehran issued a warning; the investigation of high-ranking Chinese military officials, including Zhang Youxia, has raised concerns about the PLA's combat readiness; the new US defense strategy prioritizes homeland and Chinese stability; NATO Secretary General Rutte warned that Europe cannot function without US military support, and France retaliated by pushing for strategic autonomy; tensions are rising in the South China Sea and the Taiwan Strait; the Philippines' purchase of US missiles angered China, and China canceled 49 flights to Japan; in addition, events such as the US airstrikes in Venezuela, the Sudanese military's breach of siege, and the Iranian crackdown that resulted in over 6,000 deaths have occurred. Let's delve into the pulse behind these major news stories one by one.
fullContent:
# Latest global political and military news

**Date**: 2026/1/27 23:44

## Executive Summary
Hello everyone, this is Yun Jian, your host from the Daily News Channel. Welcome to today's Daily News Channel, where we'll bring you the latest global political and military developments of the past 24 hours. This episode features a multitude of highlights: Russia launched a large-scale drone strike on multiple locations in Ukraine; Zelensky called on international partners to exert pressure; high-ranking Moscow military officials inspected the front lines and claimed to have seized over 500 square kilometers of land in January; meanwhile, trilateral negotiations between Russia, Ukraine, and the US are expected to resume on February 1st; the US Abraham Lincoln carrier strike group deployed to the Middle East in response to tensions with Iran; Trump stated that Iran wanted to negotiate, while Tehran issued a warning; the investigation of high-ranking Chinese military officials, including Zhang Youxia, has raised concerns about the PLA's combat readiness; the new US defense strategy prioritizes homeland and Chinese stability; NATO Secretary General Rutte warned that Europe cannot function without US military support, and France retaliated by pushing for strategic autonomy; tensions are rising in the South China Sea and the Taiwan Strait; the Philippines' purchase of US missiles angered China, and China canceled 49 flights to Japan; in addition, events such as the US airstrikes in Venezuela, the Sudanese military's breach of siege, and the Iranian crackdown that resulted in over 6,000 deaths have occurred. Let's delve into the pulse behind these major news stories one by one.

## Situation Analysis
Hello everyone, this is Yun Jian, your host from the Daily News Channel. Welcome to today's Daily News Channel, where we'll bring you the latest global political and military developments of the past 24 hours. This episode features a multitude of highlights: Russia launched a large-scale drone strike on multiple locations in Ukraine; Zelensky called on international partners to exert pressure; high-ranking Moscow military officials inspected the front lines and claimed to have seized over 500 square kilometers of land in January; meanwhile, trilateral negotiations between Russia, Ukraine, and the US are expected to resume on February 1st; the US Abraham Lincoln carrier strike group deployed to the Middle East in response to tensions with Iran; Trump stated that Iran wanted to negotiate, while Tehran issued a warning; the investigation of high-ranking Chinese military officials, including Zhang Youxia, has raised concerns about the PLA's combat readiness; the new US defense strategy prioritizes homeland and Chinese stability; NATO Secretary General Rutte warned that Europe cannot function without US military support, and France retaliated by pushing for strategic autonomy; tensions are rising in the South China Sea and the Taiwan Strait; the Philippines' purchase of US missiles angered China, and China canceled 49 flights to Japan; in addition, events such as the US airstrikes in Venezuela, the Sudanese military's breach of siege, and the Iranian crackdown that resulted in over 6,000 deaths have occurred. Let's delve into the pulse behind these major news stories one by one.

## Key Intelligence

### More than 165 Russian drones attacked Odessa and other locations in Ukraine; Zelensky called for international pressure.
**Source**: UNN / The Independent

According to UNN and The Independent, on January 27, 2026, Russia launched over 165 attack drones in a fierce assault on Odessa, Kherson, and Lviv, Ukraine. Odessa was hit by more than 50 drones, damaging energy and civilian targets, severely injuring five residential buildings and a church, and injuring dozens of people, including children. Shelling in the Kherson region caused buildings to catch fire, and infrastructure in Lviv was also affected. Ukrainian President Zelensky condemned such actions as undermining the diplomatic process and called on the United States and European partners not to remain silent, but to pressure Moscow through sanctions and a blockade of the Russian oil tanker fleet. DTEK confirmed that Odessa's energy facilities were severely damaged, and repairs would be time-consuming. Meanwhile, Russian President Putin's special envoy Kirill Dmitriev stated that Ukraine's withdrawal from Donbas is a key path to peace. This attack exacerbated the civilian plight and tested upcoming diplomatic negotiations.

**Reference**: https://unn.ua/en/news/every-such-russian-strike-undermines-diplomacy-zelenskyy-expects-america-and-other-partners-not-to-remain-silent-after-a-new-russian-attack;https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/ukraine-russia-war-live-putin-zelensky-trump-eu-nato-b2908185.html

### Russian Chief of the General Staff Gerasimov inspected troops in eastern Ukraine, claiming that they had seized over 500 square kilometers of land in January.
**Source**: Al Arabiya

According to a report from Al Arabiya, on January 27, 2026, Valery Gerasimov, Chief of the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces, inspected troops of the Western Forces in eastern Ukraine to assess the progress of their operations. He declared that Russian forces had seized over 500 square kilometers of Ukrainian territory in January and would continue their offensive along the entire front. This visit followed the trilateral talks in Abu Dhabi, with the next round of negotiations expected on February 1. Gerasimov's trip highlights Moscow's focus on the front lines and reflects the continuously evolving battlefield situation, despite the dual pressures of the energy crisis and cold weather facing Ukraine. This could potentially influence upcoming diplomatic efforts.

**Reference**: https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2026/01/27/russian-takes-more-than-500-square-km-of-ukraine-in-january-russia-s-top-general-says

### The USS Abraham Lincoln carrier strike group has been deployed to the Middle East to address tensions with Iran.
**Source**: Gulf News

According to Gulf News, on January 26, 2026, the U.S. nuclear-powered aircraft carrier USS Abraham Lincoln (CVN-72), accompanied by the destroyers USS Spruance, USS Michael Murphy, and USS Frank E. Peterson Jr., entered Middle Eastern waters under the command of the U.S. Fifth Fleet Central Command. The deployment aims to enhance firepower and support defense or potential operations against Iran; the carrier has previously targeted the Houthi rebels and Iran. This move stems from escalating regional tensions and tensions with Iran, with Trump administration officials stating they would strengthen naval dominance despite protests and warnings. The carrier's arrival in the Arabian Sea further underscores the U.S. military's strategic presence in the Middle East.

**Reference**: https://gulfnews.com/world/mena/uss-abraham-lincoln-aircraft-carrier-in-the-middle-east-what-you-need-to-know-1.500421868

### China is investigating high-ranking officials, including Zhang Youxia, vice chairman of the Central Military Commission, for allegedly leaking nuclear secrets and engaging in corruption.
**Source**: FDD Overnight Brief, Atalayar, Bloomberg

Data from FDD Overnight Brief, Atalayar, and Bloomberg shows that from January 24 to 26, 2026, China's Ministry of National Defense announced investigations into Zhang Youxia, Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission, and Liu Zhenli, Chief of the Joint Staff Department, on charges including serious disciplinary violations, leaking nuclear secrets to the United States, corruption, and challenging Xi Jinping's authority. Zhang Youxia is a close confidant of Xi and an official in the nuclear program; this move deepens Xi's purge, leaving only Xi and himself in the Central Military Commission. Analysts say this leads to instability within the People's Liberation Army, reduced combat readiness, and increased risks in the Taiwan direction, which Taipei describes as unusual. The incident exposes a power struggle at the highest levels.

**Reference**: https://www.fdd.org/overnight-brief/january-26-2026/,https://www.atalayar.com/en/articulo/gustavo-aristegui/geopolitical-report-january-26-2026/20260126202508222824.html,https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2026-01-27/xi-s-military-purges-raise-questions-over-china-s-pla-readiness

### The US releases its 2026 defense strategy, prioritizing homeland deterrence against China and providing limited assistance to allies.
**Source**: CSIS, GMFUS, Taiwan Plus

An analysis by CSIS, GMFUS, and Taiwan Plus indicates that the Trump administration's National Defense Strategy (renamed the War Department after the Department of Defense) to be released on January 23, 2026, will shift its focus to prioritizing homeland and border security, followed by China, seeking stable diplomacy rather than confrontation, deterrence in the Indo-Pacific, emphasizing allies sharing the burden in Europe and the Asia-Pacific, and making no mention of Taiwan. Unlike previous strategies that viewed China as the primary threat, the focus now shifts to the Western Hemisphere and the industrial base. This move may promote US-China stability, but allies are concerned about reduced support.

**Reference**: https://www.csis.org/analysis/what-does-trump-administrations-new-national-defense-strategy-say-about-china,https://www.gmfus.org/news/us-national-defense-strategy,https://www.taiwanplus.com/news/taiwan-talks/international-analysis/260127017/china-purges-general-why-new-us-defense-strategy-isnt-downplaying-china,https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mGv_QKS-CWA

### NATO Secretary General Rutte warned Europe that it would be unable to defend itself without the US, and France retaliated.
**Source**: Associated Press via KOSU

According to an Associated Press report via KOSU, on January 27, 2026, in Brussels, NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte told EU lawmakers that Europe cannot defend itself without US military assistance, including a nuclear umbrella, and that defense spending needs to double to 10% of GDP. This comes amid calls for increased military spending due to Trump's Greenland threat and France's calls for strategic autonomy. French Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot countered that Europeans must be responsible for being the European pillar of NATO. Rutte praised Trump's push for increased spending but rejected the idea of an EU military. This highlights the transatlantic divide.

**Reference**: https://www.kosu.org/news/2026-01-27/nato-chief-wishes-good-luck-to-those-who-think-europe-can-defend-itself-without-us-help

### The Philippine military has confirmed that a Philippine citizen was a Russian mercenary who died in Ukraine.
**Source**: Philstar

According to Philstar, on January 27, 2026, the Philippine military confirmed a Ukrainian report that a Filipino national had been killed while fighting as a Russian mercenary in Ukraine. The Russo-Ukrainian war has resulted in hundreds of thousands of deaths and millions of displacements, with Russia recruiting thousands of foreign nationals to fight. This incident serves as a reminder of the global issue of mercenaries.

**Reference**: https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2026/01/27/2503836/military-verifying-ukraine-report-filipino-killed-fighting-russia

### Hamas seeks police role in Gaza, former disarmament negotiator
**Source**: Al Arabiya

According to Al Arabiya, on January 27, 2026, Hamas, having controlled less than half of Gaza following the Trump-brokered October ceasefire, sought to have its police play a role in upcoming disarmament negotiations. The source stated this move was intended to maintain order, but it has sparked controversy.

**Reference**: https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2026/01/27/hamas-seeks-role-for-its-police-in-gaza-ahead-of-disarmament-talks-sources

### The Philippines plans to purchase the US Typhoon missile system; China warns of an arms race.
**Source**: CBS News

CBS News reported that on January 27, 2026, the Philippines announced its purchase of the U.S. Typhoon missile system to safeguard its rights in the South China Sea, prompting a warning from China that it would trigger an arms race. The U.S. ambassador condemned China's water cannon attacks on Philippine vessels, endangering lives. The South China Sea dispute has recently escalated.

**Reference**: https://www.cbsnews.com/tag/south-china-sea/

### Xi Jinping spoke with Vietnam Party General Secretary To Lan, emphasizing the need to deepen bilateral relations.
**Source**: China Daily / Xinhua / Global Times

According to reports from China Daily, Xinhua News Agency, and the Global Times, on the evening of January 26, 2026, Xi Jinping spoke by phone with To Lan, General Secretary of the Communist Party of Vietnam, emphasizing the need to deepen bilateral relations and promote cooperation. Both sides pledged closer collaboration, a move that highlights the strong ties between China and Vietnam amidst regional dynamics.

**Reference**: https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/latestnews210

### China cancels 49 flights to Japan, escalating tensions.
**Source**: China Daily

According to China Daily, starting January 26, 2026, China will cancel all 49 flights to Japan, updated to January 27. This move stems from political and military tensions and could escalate bilateral friction.

**Reference**: https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/latestnews210

### Zelensky said the next round of talks between Ukraine, the US, and Russia may be held on February 1.
**Source**: China Daily

According to China Daily, on January 27, 2026, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy stated that Ukraine, the United States, and Russia might hold their next meeting on February 1, indicating potential progress in conflict diplomacy.

**Reference**: https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/latestnews210

### A UN report states that Iran's crackdown on protests has resulted in over 6,126 deaths.
**Source**: NPR

According to NPR, citing UN data, as of January 27, 2026, more than 6,126 people have died in nationwide protests in Iran, exacerbating political turmoil.

**Reference**: https://www.npr.org/2026/01/27/nx-s1-5689793/6-126-iran-crackdown-protests-death-toll

### Poland emerges as a new security pole in Europe, with large-scale arms purchases strengthening its eastern flank.
**Source**: Anadolu Agency

According to Anadolu Agency, on January 27, 2026, Poland will become a European security hub through massive military purchases and the reinforcement of 124 miles of its eastern border by 2026, enhancing NATO's deterrence against the Russian threat on its eastern flank.

**Reference**: https://www.aa.com.tr/en/europe/-indispensable-new-pole-poland-reshapes-europe-s-security-map/3812047

### Sudanese army ends two-year siege of Dilin in South Kodofan province by rapid support forces.
**Source**: Anadolu Ajansı, Al Arabiya

Anadolu Ajansı and Al Arabiya reported that on January 27, 2026, the Sudanese army successfully defeated the Rapid Support Force (RSF) and severely damaged its militias, ending a two-year siege of Dilin, the second largest city in South Kodofan province. The army vowed to eliminate the RSF to stabilize the country, and this was part of the Kodofan offensive.

**Reference**: https://www.aa.com.tr/en/world/morning-briefing-jan-27-2026/3811620, https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2026/01/27/sudan-army-breaks-rsf-siege-on-southern-city-of-dilling

### US airstrikes near Caracas, Venezuela, kill dozens of people.
**Source**: Wikipedia / Various

According to reports from Wikipedia, the NYT, and Al Jazeera, on January 27, 2026, the US Operation Southern Spear launched airstrikes on the Fort Tiuna and Francisco de Miranda air bases near Caracas, using Hellfire missiles, killing 40-100 people, including civilians, 23 Venezuelan soldiers, and 32 Cuban personnel. Maduro declared a national emergency, and the FAA lifted the no-fly zone over the Caribbean; this was part of the war on drugs.

**Reference**: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events/January_2026

### Iran warns of increased vulnerability from US aircraft carrier deployment; Tehran's Billboard mocks the move.
**Source**: RTHK

RTHK reports that on January 27, 2026, the US Abraham Lincoln Strike Group increased its firepower in the Middle East near Iran. Iranian officials stated that the increased vulnerability was a factor, and billboards in New Tehran depicted a destroyed aircraft carrier with the phrase "wind and storm." Hezbollah rallies warned of an attack on Iran, igniting the entire region. Trump stated that the fleet was in position, and Iran wanted to make a deal. Economic protests have continued since December.

**Reference**: https://gbcode.rthk.hk/TuniS/news.rthk.hk/rthk/en/component/k2/1841473-20260127.htm

### Scholars say a window of stability exists between the US and China in 2026, but it is fragile.
**Source**: China Daily

China Daily updated on January 27, 2026: A seminar by experts David Kang and Robert Sutter stated that the US-China relationship is better than it is at the end of 2025. Trump's deal-oriented approach ignores threats, but increased defense budgets may create tension. Concerns are raised about Taiwan (US sale of 11B weapons in 2025), and the outlook for the Asia-Pacific region is pessimistic. High-level contacts are crucial.

**Reference**: https://global.chinadaily.com.cn/a/202601/27/WS69783d3da310d6866eb35f75.html

### European Parliament postpones decision on EU-US trade agreement
**Source**: China Daily

According to China Daily, on January 27, 2026, the European Parliament's decision to extend the EU-US trade agreement will impact transatlantic political and economic relations.

**Reference**: https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/latestnews210

### Myanmar's pro-military party declared victory in the general election, and the military government underwent a complete transformation.
**Source**: Taipei Times

According to the Taipei Times, in an election manipulated by the Myanmar military junta on January 27, 2026, the US Democratic Party (USDP) claimed a majority of seats and will form a government under President Min Aung Hlaing. Observers criticize this as a repackaging of military rule following the 2021 coup, which could trigger a civil war.

**Reference**: https://www.taipeitimes.com/News/world/archives/2026/01/27/2003851303

### Saudi Arabia accuses the UAE of interfering in Yemen and Libya, threatening a new crisis.
**Source**: Taipei Times

According to the Taipei Times, on January 27, 2026, Saudi media attacked the UAE for human rights abuses, supported the separatist movement in Yemen and Ras Mosque in Libya, and advocated for the division of Africa. This further exacerbates the rifts in the Gulf following the conflict in Yemen.

**Reference**: https://www.taipeitimes.com/News/world/archives/2026/01/27/2003851302

### The war in Ukraine plunged Kyiv into darkness and extreme cold; Zelensky criticized the West for insufficient pressure.
**Source**: Atalayar

Atalayar reports that on January 26, 2026, following tripartite negotiations in Abu Dhabi, Zelensky emphasized that he would not relinquish territory in exchange for EU membership, criticizing the West for its weak pressure on Russia. The Russian ground offensive resulted in casualties and infrastructure destruction, and the extreme cold exacerbated the plight of civilians.

**Reference**: https://www.atalayar.com/en/articulo/politics/the-war-in-ukraine-plunges-kyiv-into-darkness-and-extreme-cold/20260126120613222785.html

### Qatar launches the Arabian Gulf Security 4 joint military exercise, with US special forces participating.
**Source**: Khaleej Times / WAM

According to the Khaleej Times, from January 26 to February 4, 2026, Qatar, the UAE, Gulf Cooperation Council countries, and US special forces will conduct "Arabian Gulf Security 4" exercises in the Arabian Gulf, involving over 260 hours of training across more than 70 scenarios, focusing on counter-terrorism emergency command. The exercises aim to enhance Gulf security cooperation.

**Reference**: https://www.khaleejtimes.com/world/gulf/qatar-joint-military-exercise-uae-gcc-us-units

### US RQ-4B Global Hawk and MQ-4C Triton drones are monitoring Iran from the UAE.
**Source**: DefenceGeek Twitter

According to DefenceGeek's Twitter account, on January 27, 2026, at Al Dhafra Air Base in Abu Dhabi, three US Air Force RQ-4B Global Hawks and two Navy MQ-4C Tritons were deployed to monitor Iran and enhance intelligence capabilities in the Middle East.

**Reference**: https://x.com/DefenceGeek

### Fujian Coast Guard conducts routine patrol in Kinmen; Taiwan military conducts live-fire exercise in northeastern waters.
**Source**: Global Times

According to the Global Times, on January 26, 2026, the Fujian Coast Guard conducted a routine law enforcement patrol in waters near Kinmen, while Taiwan's Ministry of National Defense fired shots in waters northeast of Taiwan. Tensions across the Taiwan Strait continue.

**Reference**: https://www.globaltimes.cn/china/society/index.html

### French Foreign Minister responds to Rutte: Europe must assume its own security responsibility
**Source**: Politico

According to Politico, on January 27, 2026, in Brussels, after Rutte stated that Europe would be vulnerable without the US, French Foreign Minister Barrot posted on X, "Europeans can and must be responsible for security." Trump's Greenland tensions and the US strategic shift are prompting Europe to take a leading role in addressing the Russian threat.

**Reference**: https://www.politico.eu/article/france-snaps-back-nato-mark-rutte-european-defense/

### US-Iran tensions push up oil prices despite oversupply.
**Source**: Anadolu Ajansı

According to Anadolu Ajansı, on January 26, 2026, Middle East geopolitical risks, particularly US-Iran tensions, increased oil price risk premiums despite ample supply. The biggest pressure on the US comes from the Iranian economy, and Libyan oil prices are also linked to record levels.

**Reference**: https://www.aa.com.tr/en/energy/oil/oil-edges-higher-on-us-iran-tensions/54289

### Hamas claims the retrieval of the last hostage's body proves its commitment to a ceasefire.
**Source**: China Daily

According to China Daily, on January 26-27, 2026, Hamas claimed to have retrieved the bodies of the last hostages from Gaza, demonstrating its commitment to the ceasefire amidst political developments in the Middle East.

**Reference**: https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/latestnews210

### Nigeria accuses military officers of coup attempt; US reveals directed energy weapon used to capture Maduro.
**Source**: GeopoliticsUnplugged

According to GeopoliticsUnplugged, on January 26, 2026, Nigeria detained 16 soldiers in a suspected coup attempt against President Tinubu; Trump revealed that the US used 'Discombobulator' directed energy weapons and cyber tools to capture Maduro, paralyzing Venezuela's defense.

**Reference**: https://geopoliticsunplugged.substack.com/p/eu-formally-kicks-out-russia-5k-gold

### Rutte criticizes the EU's dream of strategic autonomy, saying Europe needs to double its spending.
**Source**: Le Monde

Le Monde reports that on January 27, 2026, in Brussels, Rutte rejected EU autonomy, stating that without the US nuclear umbrella, defense spending would need to double. France must be held accountable for its anti-European stance.

**Reference**: https://www.lemonde.fr/en/international/article/2026/01/27/nato-chief-mark-rutte-warns-europe-it-can-t-defend-itself-without-the-us_6749843_4.html

### Europe accelerates its rearmament program, emerging as a new superpower.
**Source**: The Telegraph

According to The Telegraph, on January 26, 2026, following Trump's threats, Europe accelerated its rearmament, with Ukraine planning to produce 20 million drones by 2026.

**Reference**: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2026/01/26/plans-turn-europe-new-superpower/

### Trump becomes a burden on Europe's far right; Greenland's tariffs alienate allies.
**Source**: NYT

According to the NYT, on January 27, 2026, European nationalists distanced themselves from Trump due to threats to Greenland, tariffs, and sovereignty challenges, leading to a shift in the previous alliance.

**Reference**: https://www.nytimes.com/2026/01/27/world/europe/trump-liability-europe-far-right-populists.html
title: Latest global political and military news
summary: Hello everyone, this is Yun Jian, your host from the Daily News Channel. Welcome to today's Daily News Channel, where we'll bring you the latest global political and military developments of the past 24 hours. This episode features a multitude of highlights: Russia launched a large-scale drone strike on multiple locations in Ukraine; Zelensky called on international partners to exert pressure; high-ranking Moscow military officials inspected the front lines and claimed to have seized over 500 square kilometers of land in January; meanwhile, trilateral negotiations between Russia, Ukraine, and the US are expected to resume on February 1st; the US Abraham Lincoln carrier strike group deployed to the Middle East in response to tensions with Iran; Trump stated that Iran wanted to negotiate, while Tehran issued a warning; the investigation of high-ranking Chinese military officials, including Zhang Youxia, has raised concerns about the PLA's combat readiness; the new US defense strategy prioritizes homeland and Chinese stability; NATO Secretary General Rutte warned that Europe cannot function without US military support, and France retaliated by pushing for strategic autonomy; tensions are rising in the South China Sea and the Taiwan Strait; the Philippines' purchase of US missiles angered China, and China canceled 49 flights to Japan; in addition, events such as the US airstrikes in Venezuela, the Sudanese military's breach of siege, and the Iranian crackdown that resulted in over 6,000 deaths have occurred. Let's delve into the pulse behind these major news stories one by one.
